subject: Re: Hi Guys, I have a question for you. I have around 50-60 sites curre...
preview: Re: Hi Guys, I have a question for you. I have around 50-60 sites curre...

full_threads.body: Re: Hi Guys, I have a question for you. I have around 50-60 sites curre...

Hi,

We have a knowledge base article where you can check our pricing for larger amount of sites: https://kinsta.com/knowledgebase/wordpress-bulk-migration-pricing/
We only allow one WordPress site in one install, so 60 sites means 60 additional installs will be required. You have to upgrade your plan first in order to request the bulk migration option. Because the sites are available with WPEngine, we'll need only the WPE login and we can migrate them for $40 / site.
We can prioritize sites or add maintenance mode also, if required, but we'll need WP-admin login credentials in order to install a maintenance mode plugin.

Thanks,
Peter

--

https://static.intercomassets.com/avatars/64049/square_128/doug_profil-1485941361.jpg?1485941361 Peter from Kinsta

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:53 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Great thanks James!

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:52 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

No worries, I'll pass that information on too and see what we can work out.

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:50 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Yep one sec...

It's exactly 60 at the moment.

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:50 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Understood, yeah that should make things super smooth. I'll get a firm answer for you today (European time, tonight for us) as to how the best way to proceed would be.

Do you have an exact number of sites you'd want us to handle the migration for? Or is "50 to 60" as close as you can get?

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:48 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Around 90% of them are more 'brochure' style sites, i.e. not eccom or user driven. For those ones, we will probably do ourselves to avoid those complications. For the ones that you guys migrate a lot of our clients either don't have or use their backend admin access either. So it will be easy to enforce a content freeze of sorts.

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:46 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Understood completely. :D

Are they e-commerce sites, or otherwise user-driven? It might be a bit of an exercise coordinating everything anyway, but if we can just make a list of them and do them as we get time it should go fairly smoothly.

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:44 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hey James, yeah for sure, no huge rush. Happy to wait. Cheers

It would be awesome as I can just focus on doing the final checks and DNS updates. I'm sure you know how 'fun

'fun' it can be to get DNS access from clients https://js.intercomcdn.com/images/emojis/32x32/1f604.png

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:42 AM, "James Fraser" <james.fraser@kinsta.intercom-mail.com> wrote:

Hi there,

I'm honestly not sure of the answer to that question. I believe in the past we've done it that way, as long as they're all accounted for it works out okay. I'm not sure if the forms are required for us to account for them or not.

Are you in a hurry to get the ball rolling on this or can I escalate it to someone in our Budapest team to get you a firm answer on that?

On Thu, May 31, 2018 at 10:41 AM, "WP Perk Support Team" <support@wpperk.com> wrote:

Hi Guys, I have a question for you. I have around 50-60 sites currently hosted on WPEngine. I'm keen to move them over to you guys at some point as I'm loving the servers and service you provide. So the question: If I upgrade our account to allow for the extra site and pay for you to migrate them all, would I need to fill out a migration request for each site or would I simply be able to grant you access to our WPEngine portal? Obviously the later is my preferred as it will save me a heap of time. Thanks in advance!
